title: League during school holidays
body:
This is my first year playing League so I've never experienced it during school holidays.

Legit question - do you get a spike of idiot 14 year olds playing more often during the days? I'm honestly not sure whether to take a 6 week break from ranked just in case.

replies.body: I honestly don't get what all the fuss is about with teenagers or younger kids playing League. Just because they are younger does not mean they will be bad players, however I do agree that the younger 12 year - 14 year olds are usually more toxic. Just mute them and get along with your day.

>
> Just because they are younger does not mean they will be bad players, however I do agree that the younger 12 year - 14 year olds are usually more toxic.

It's not their skill level that bothers me. Bad players exist at all ages. It's their inability to have a grown up conversation without resorting to swearing, name calling and caps that shits me.

Yeah, I can mute them. But that makes it hard to communicate.

> [{quoted}](name=ninja150z,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=upu8EZWd,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2016-12-19T14:22:47.499+0000)
>
> league is not about having a conversation
> 
> if you play poorly expect to be abused

Good plays is generally proportional to the solidity of team communication, unless you're playing rambo-champs, but then again, a team full of them is not going to work. So whether you like conversation or not, it looks like it's found you first.

There is a big difference between communication and a conversation... 
Pinging is communication, but it is not a conversation.
Do you understand now? Good. 

Also, the conversation never found me first, we were specifically talking about an in-game conversations, of which I NEVER DO, unless you consider some valid remarks as being a conversation, in which case you are also semantically uninformed.  

Also, I did not start the conversation, so how could I have been the one to supposedly find it first?
Right, so if I'm jungling, on the opposite side of the map, get pinged for assistance and 10 seconds later my team mate is dead and flaming me for being "so bad" I should ping in response?

do you think that your chances of winning would increase if you were to dispute whether or not you are bad? 

in this case you obviously ignore them.

Holiday season always have a tendency to degrade the average game experience in some manner, either the players' skill qualities are poorer than usual (which is perfectly forgivable) or that there would be more asshats around the corner (which is NOT forgivable). Though really, while noticeable if you really look into it, it's really not that significant of a change as a whole.

However do note, many of the "idiot 14 year olds" are actually late-teens or young adults, rather than the middle school kids that always get the hit for them.

I think on average I've enjoyed playing with people who are out of school or at least in their last year of high school. I remember joking at college " I have 2 hours before the high schoolers return home from school" as I would quickly try grind ranked in the remaining time I had left before the influx of "salty teens". OCE is an interesting server though in which I believe is because the Australian society is much different to other countries where offensive language is becoming more acceptable these days when compared to other countries. So, I think that might be a factor of the OCE toxicness. But I think it is good to still play and develop resilience towards negative players who may or may not be high schoolers. I will say for certain though plat and low diamond elo is where most of the salt is on the OCE server.{{champion:17}}

i mean obviously. Happens every holidays. The sucky part is that filter throughout the entire day.

You got the kids who stay on normal schedules so wake up early and play in the morning, the kids that play in the afternoon like usual and the other kids that stay up all night. Legit no escape.

Think i'll only be playing Flex with friends during the holidays.
yes, but it's not that much worse
I wonder if this is the reason my last 7 teams in a row have been full of jonny jackers.
